text: Then came the night of the first falling [1:noun]. It was seen early in the morning, rushing over [2:place] eastward, a line of flame high in the atmosphere. Hundreds must have [3:verb-past] it, and taken it for an ordinary falling [1:noun]. [4:name] described it as leaving a [5:color] streak behind it that glowed for [6:number] seconds. [7:name], our [8:adjective] authority on [1:noun], stated that the height of its first appearance was about ninety or one hundred miles. It seemed to him that it [9:verb-past] earth about one hundred miles east of him.
